Text.Value: Feel free to look around the temple - but fair warning. The Investigator won't change her mind without significant new evidence.
Brilgor was a refugee. No one sticks up for them at the best of times, and with Gortash in power...
Shirra passed away last year - peacefully, mind. We buried her in the crypt under the temple, if you wish to visit.
Investigator Valeria thinks it a murder, and is content to blame Brilgor. The politically convenient target.
Not for any God worthy of the name.
Where can I find the Investigator?
Sharess' Caress would be my best bet. That's her usual haunt after 'closing' a case.
Ah, yes, Father Lorgan's passing. My condolences.
Apology accepted.
Hah! If more priests spoke muck like you I'd join a church. Nice one.
Leave.
Investigator Valeria might be content to blame the politically convenient target, but I'm not.
I suppose you're right. The Crying One has much more on his plate than curse words, given what just happened here.
Sounded like you were having quite the disagreement.
Shitey little elephant. Oh, um. I apologise, stranger, language like that hardly befits a rector of Ilmater.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: 'shitey little elephant' directed at valeria (who is offstage), 'oh' turns to player

Text.Value: Any idea what I should be looking for?
Don't apologise. Brilgor couldn't have killed Father Lorgan. He doesn't fit the killer's profile.
I really hope you find something. For all our sakes.
If there's a trail to follow, I can track it. Let me look into it.
Don't apologise, sounded like a load of bollocks anyway.
I best get going.
I may not care for the Crying God, but I see your turmoil, priest. Let me help.
Queen Vlaakith would never forgive such an infraction, but I'm sure your weakling god would.
I'm sure our god would grant you clemency, sister. He understands pain better than most.
You're in pain, Sister. Ilmater would forgive you. So would the rest of the Triad.
Then your god is a hypocrite. Ilmater has done much worse than swear in his time.
Given the circumstances, I think Ilmater will forgive you. My god would.
You doubt her verdict. I will investigate - see where the true blame falls.
Look, Investigator, Brilgor might have been a criminal, but he was no murderer. You're missing something, you have to be -

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: we begin with Yannis and Valeria arguing. Yannis is already very upset and frustrated.

Text.Value: Better to occasionally contradict one's morals than to have none. That being said...
I can tell you where to find her, but she won't be very chatty, I'm afraid.
Thank you, friend. I am grateful for your compassion.
Enough, Yannis! Listen to yourself. You are defending a man who ritually slaughtered your high priest.
Stick to being a place of worship. Helping people got your high priest killed.
Two people just died on temple grounds. Our high priest, Father Lorgan, and one of the new refugees, Brilgor.
He who shoulders the suffering of others can never be weak. But...
I am worried about this temple. Ilmater wills that we try and help people. With Gortash in power...
Leave.
You think Ilmater looks at a Baldurian differently to anyone else? I like to think the gods are smarter than that.
Leave.
I know how annoying planar beings can be. Especially ones from Celestia.
You could certainly say that.
Don't be disrespectful, killing is a form of worship.
If we don't help them, who will? The kind Lord Gortash? Don't make me laugh.
Now, if you'll excuse me, I've a temple to run and a high priest to replace.
It wasn't just Father Lorgan.
Thank you. I normally wouldn't speak so harshly, but these are rather unique circumstances.
The evidence speaks for itself. Brilgor killed Father Lorgan, then be it out of shame, or profane duty, offed himself with the same blade. Case closed, Sister Yannis.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Choices][Hollyphant] circling around Yannis, it stop, delivers the line "case closed, " and then fly off.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The hollyphant stops circling yannis, delivers the line "case closed," and then begins to leave

Text.Value: If you think the Investigator did a shoddy job, I can look into the murder for you.
Valeria never found the murder weapon, so that could be a start. Anything disproving the refugee murder-suicide angle, really.
What makes Brilgor politically convenient?
Allow me to help you - my god would bid me aid a follower of Ilmater.
It would be a delicious irony if the hollyphant - a celestial - was wrong. I'll look into it.
You mean your high priest harbouring criminals?
Let me help you - I'll look around, see if there's anything to prove Brilgor innocent.
Aiding others is Ilmater's will. If I proved Brilgor's innocence, would that help?
I'm sure there are plenty of people from Baldur's Gate who still need your help.
I don't imagine Ilmater cares about you swearing.
No murder story I've ever read has ended simply - I bet there's more afoot here.
You should worry more about your temple's safety than this 'Brilgor' person.
Well, I expect the Flaming Fist will ban refugee aid now one of them's blamed for murder.
Can you tell me where to find Shirra Clarwen?
I wouldn't go that far, but the Investigator is being particularly challenging right now.
They make a fine target for the real culprit, too - unlikely to be missed where they weren't wanted to begin with.

EditorData.NodeContext: Quietly cynical - she has her experience of investigating murders. Distaste for the city's rejection of refugees.

Text.Value: Brilgor was a criminal, sure, but there's no way he killed Lorgan.
What did happen here?

Synopsis:
Group dialog with priestess Yannis and the hollyphant detective.
The tollyphant tells Yannis that she has solved the crime and leaves afterwards.
!!! It is possible for the player to solve the murder case before this dialog happens, so we need to have a reactivity to it.
